job_description: Software Engineer - job post Advantis Global, Inc. 27 reviews 6903 133rd Ct NE, Redmond, WA 98052 $75 - $90 an hour -  Full-time, Part-time, Contract Advantis Global, Inc. 27 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 21 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $75 - $90 an hour Job Type Full-time Part-time Contract Job Description : Meta's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different type of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to express what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Meta are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. At Reality Labs (FRL), our goal is to explore, innovate and design novel interfaces and hardware subsystems for the next generation of virtual, augmented, and mixed reality experiences. We are looking for a skilled and motivated Software Engineer to join our team. We are specifically looking for a candidate with experience in Unreal Engine (Blueprints and C++) and who can work with a team of researchers who are building and evaluating prototype research devices. More broadly, the chosen candidate will work with a diverse and highly interdisciplinary team of researchers and engineers and will have access to cutting edge technology, resources, and testing facilities. The ideal candidate will be someone who likes to learn constantly, dive into new areas with unfamiliar technologies, and embrace the ambiguity of AR/VR problem solving. They will also be someone who likes to collaborate in a team environment across multiple scientific and engineering disciplines, making the architectural tradeoffs required to rapidly deliver software solutions. Responsibilities ● Work side by side with research scientists to enable a huge array of user studies that evaluate the perceptual effects of various AR/VR systems and features ● Analyze, evaluate, design, develop, integrate, debug and test real-time AR and VR software for advanced prototypes and user experiences ● Build software, tools, infrastructure, documentation and other systems that enable research scientists to be more effective and efficient ● Educate researchers and other team members on software engineering best practices, tips and techniques ● Write clean readable code, debug complex problems that span systems, prioritize ruthlessly and get things done with a high level of efficiency Required Qualifications ● BS degree in the field of computer science or related field. ● 5+ years experience with C++, including C++11 (and up) features and principles. ● 2+ years experience using Unreal Engine 4 (or 4+ years with another large scale engine such as Unity, CryEngine) ● 2+ years experience creating, extending, integrating and maintaining real-time 3D game engine systems such as graphics rendering, audio, physics, networking or animation ● Experience shipping one or more products using standard software development toolsets such as source control and continuous integration systems Desired Qualifications One or more of the following would be a plus: ● Experience developing AR/VR applications ● Experience with 3D math and linear algebra ● Experience integrating third-party hardware and custom SDKs into existing engines Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Salary: $75.00 - $90.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Ability to commute/relocate: Redmond, WA 98052: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Position Summary... What you'll do... As a Software Development Engineer in Test, you will be designing and developing automated solutions that help guarantee the software quality across a wide range of products and services. In addition, you will be creating and designing test automation for iOS and Android apps. You will be working with cross-functional teams across the organization to launch best in class technical solutions for testing frameworks. You should be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity that's higher than most projects and relish the idea of solving problems. Along the way, we guarantee that you'll learn a ton, have fun and make a positive impact on many customers. Basic Qualification Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar technical field. 2+ years of experience as a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET). Experience developing automation in at least one of the following languages - Java, C#/C++, Python. Experienced in apps in augmented reality. Preferred Qualification Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools, with demonstrated experience in an SDET role . Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills. Coding experience with automated testing frameworks, tools, services, and physical devices. Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions. Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems. Excellent communication, collaboration, reporting, analytical and problem-solving skills. Comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings. MIS Application Developer - Aerospace & Defense - Remote - job post Aramark 20,054 reviews Seattle, WA 98101 • Remote Part-time Aramark 20,054 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Job Description The Senior Developer will be responsible for a lead role on the analysis, design, testing, implementation and support of Aerospace and Defense IT projects. Analyzes requirements, designs, develops and implements new solutions in an effort to align IT solutions with business initiatives. Evaluates, develops technical design specifications for existing or proposed systems and related procedures. The incumbent may also be responsible for leading mid-size projects. Job Responsibilities The Aerospace and Defense IT team is tasked to develop, deploy and maintain custom developed software enhancements used throughout Aramark. The Developer will also be expected to become an IT Subject Matter Expert for the Facilities applications including Maximo and related applications which are developed by external vendors and used within Aramark for critical business processes. This person will report to the IT Director and will principally support the Operations team as well as support various work streams for the Business Teams. This individual will be directly responsible for developing the software and the technical specifications which are outputs from functional requirements gathered from the business teams. This person will interact regularly with members of the field-based user community, a broader internal and remote-based development team, and have regular interactions with members of the LOB and Account Operations Teams and the Deployment team. Coordination with all the aforementioned teams is required to ensure that the system requirements are understood and implemented as planned. Detailed Job Responsibilities Designing, maintaining, and supporting IBM Maximo application Supports Business Operations by implementing business rules, custom UI, and reporting Supports traditional facilities software including a variety of CMMS support systems including data collection, . Participating in workshops and meetings, facilitating and recording business requirements and preparing documentation. Participate in a lead role, overseeing and on occasion managing the 3rd party development efforts. Supporting and managing Web based and mobile based applications. Coordination with the Maximo administrators and other members of the IT development staff to review and validate requirements and evaluate technical feasibilities Expected to develop time estimates for new or modified work items including constraints, dependencies and other variables under the guidance of the IT team. Coordinates with various consulting practices and assimilate needs into several on-going work streams Developing and maintaining technical documentation on current and future state of information technology systems, applications, interfaces and processes. Estimate and establish cost parameters for new development of software, interfaces and process improvements under the guidance of the IT team. Will be required to work with a project manager to collapse new project items into individual or comprehensive plans. Part time test scenario / case development and execution. Will complete work in accordance with corporate established SDLC processes. Maintain work tracking including current status and estimated completion date and communicate status. Research and analyze new tools / processes that can help the team become more efficient Participate in the code promotion and management processes Manage the assignment and prioritization of tasks Expected to become SME for the managed projects, performing demos, participating in Focus groups, and other required duties. Provide support and training for end users as needed Will be required to provide support for off hour releases as scheduled. Working with business to implement dashboard and reporting in QlikView and/or PowerBI. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or a similar discipline is required coupled with the desire to succeed in an enriching development environment Minimum of 1 year experience in Javascript development Minimum of 1 year experience with Maximo 7.6 or higher system development Minimum of 1 year experience with DB2 SQL databases and technologies Demonstrated skills in the development and maintenance of enterprise-level systems Proficient in support of integration components & web services Leadership in solution design and development and compliance to SDLC & enterprise standards Demonstrated experience in collaborating with stakeholders and business process owners is a must Experience in PowerBI or related reporting tools a plus Experience with creation and maintenance of functional and/or technical specifications is required Experience with change control processes, code migration and management tools is required (ITG, DevOps, etc.) Experience with Testing Tool Suites (Microsoft, Quality Center, Telerik, etc..) a plus Creative and flexible in attitude and style to adapt to new situations in a rapidly changing, dynamic environment Strong oral and written communications skills Proficient in SQL querying to provide analytic support. #FS-100 About Aramark Our Mission Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law. About Aramark The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

Strong knowledge of RESTful/JSON/XML. Hands on proficiency with Azure services. Industrial experience of operating 24x7x365 tier-1 services. Industrial experience of platform security including Authentication/Authorization, API Gateway, or SSL termination. Industrial experiences of CI/CD and applying within software development.
